div1.p: Lazear reports that there is little chance of getting leave.

div1.head: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, April 20, 1900
div1.opener:
DR. JESSE W. LAZEAR,
835 PARK AVE.
OFFICE HOURS,
4.30-6 P. M.
Columbia Barracks
Havana Cuba
BALTIMORE. Apr. 20, 1900
My dear Mother,
div1.p:
Your letter of Apr 11 came a
few days ago but after Mabel had
started. I have not yet been able to
hear of the arrival of the “Sedgwick”.
We thought they would let cable her
arrival at N.Y. to the office here but
they did not do so. My shanty seems
very lonesome now.

Don't bother about what Mrs. Shuter says.
Her son here is little better than an imbecile
and his yarns are not to be relied
on and Mrs Shuter herself does not
seem very acute in obsessing or sound
in judging.

There is not much chance of my going to
the states this summer. Recently men who
have been two years without leave have have been
refused and later in the summer these
will be come less chance of it.
I enjoyed the book man very much
